intro: Oxythece scrobiculata, commonly known as the rough-leaved oxythece, is a flowering plant native to parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic, compound leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. Its roots are often harvested for culinary or medicinal use. Oxythece scrobiculata thrives in moist, temperate climates and is often found in forested areas.
